page.description: Adds a new record to a table. Data is CRLF delimited list. Style 1 - data is fieldname=fieldvalue pairs, Style 2 data is just fieldvalues in same order as fieldnames
page.syntax: Result_Flag as L = record_add(C tablename ,C data [,N style ])
page.returns: Result_Flag (L) = .T. = the record was added. .F. = the record was not added.

argument.name: data
argument.description: A CR-LF delimited list of the field values to add as a new record. The data can be presented in two different formats as Defined by the Style argument.

description.p: Default = 1. An optional style selector that defines the format of the *[xb:data]* parameter. Value can be 1 or 2.
When entering data in an auto-increment field, use Style 1 and leave the value of the field blank. E.g. *[xb:"Fieldname1 = "]*.
See explanation below for more information.

page.discussion: RECORD_ADD() adds a new record to Table_Name using the field values specified by Data_List.Note : The RECORD_ADD() function opens and closes the table. You should not use TABLE.OPEN() or TABLE.CLOSE().
page.example: dim cs as C cs = "00000010" + crlf() + "Layout" + crlf() + "Report" ? cs = 00000010 Layout Report record_add("category", cs, 2)

section.title: Setting the Style
section.description: The Style selector defines the format of the data. There are two options available:

case.title: Style = 1
case.description: The default style used, data is listed using a CR-LF delimited list of *[xb:<field_name> = <value>]* pairs. For example:
case.example: Fieldname1 = Value1 Fieldname2 = Value2 FieldnameN = ValueN
